paper_abstract: In this paper, we have proved that in every underdetermined linear system Ax = b, there corresponds a constant p* (A, b) > 0 such that every solution to the l(p)-norm minimization problem also solves the l(0)-norm minimization problem whenever 0 < p < p* (A, b). This phenomenon is named NP/CM P equivalence.
paper_title: NP/CMP Equivalence: A Phenomenon Hidden Among Sparsity Models l(0) Minimization and l(p) Minimization for Information Processing
